definitions: direction halfway between south and west on a compass
area or region located in the southwestern part of a country or territory
examples: The storm is moving toward the southwest rapidly
We drove southwest for three hours before stopping
Many retirees move to the southwest for warmer weather
The southwest region is known for its desert landscapes

definitions: act of breaking free from confinement or avoiding danger
way out or method used to get away from something
examples: The prisoner's escape shocked the entire community yesterday
Their narrow escape from the fire was miraculous
The emergency escape is located at the rear
Reading books became her escape from daily stress

definitions: large enclosed area for sports events or public entertainment
particular area of activity, interest, or competition in society or life
examples: The basketball arena holds twenty thousand excited fans
They built a new arena for the hockey team
She entered the political arena after years in business
The company competes in the global technology arena

definitions: woman believed to have magical powers, especially in folklore and fantasy
offensive term for a woman considered to be unpleasant or malicious
examples: The witch cast a spell in the fairy tale
Children dressed as witches for the Halloween party
Don't call her a witch just because she disagrees
The old witch next door always complains about noise

definitions: polite, respectful, or considerate behavior toward other people
service or privilege provided free of charge as a gesture of goodwill
examples: She showed great courtesy to all the guests
Common courtesy requires holding doors for others
The hotel offers courtesy shuttles to the airport
They received courtesy tickets to the premiere event

definitions: three-dimensional representation of a person, animal, or object carved or cast in material
examples: The bronze statue stands in the town square
They unveiled a statue honoring the war veterans

definitions: hand with fingers bent inward and held tightly against the palm
examples: He raised his fist in victory after winning
She clenched her fists in anger and frustration

definitions: large fortified building or group of buildings from medieval times
piece in chess that can move horizontally or vertically
examples: The ancient castle overlooks the entire valley below
Tourists flock to visit the historic castle ruins
She moved her castle to protect the king
The castle is also known as a rook

definitions: small organized group of people with a specific task
group of players forming a team in sports
examples: The police squad arrived at the scene quickly
A cleaning squad maintains the building every night
The football squad practices every afternoon after school
She made the cheerleading squad this year finally

definitions: vacation trip on a large ship with stops at various places
leisurely journey or drive, especially one taken for pleasure
examples: They booked a Caribbean cruise for their anniversary
The cruise ship can accommodate three thousand passengers
Let's take a cruise down the coastal highway
Police cruise the neighborhood to maintain safety

definitions: official residence or offices of an ambassador in a foreign country
examples: The embassy provides services to citizens traveling abroad
Protesters gathered outside the embassy gates this morning

definitions: ability to accept delays, problems, or suffering without becoming angry or anxious
examples: Teaching young children requires enormous patience every day
Her patience finally paid off after years of trying

definitions: plant with many branches growing from near the ground
wild or uncultivated country, especially in Africa or Australia
examples: The rose bush blooms beautifully every spring season
Birds nest in the dense bush behind our house
They went camping in the Australian bush last summer
The village is located deep in the African bush

definitions: set of clothes worn together for a particular occasion
informal term for an organization or group of people
examples: She bought a new outfit for the wedding
His outfit perfectly matched the formal dress code
That construction outfit does excellent work around town
The whole outfit moved to a bigger office

definitions: structure of bars or wires used to confine birds or animals
examples: The bird sang sweetly from inside its cage
Zoo animals shouldn't be kept in small cages

definitions: large predatory fish with cartilaginous skeleton and sharp teeth
person who preys on others, especially in business dealings
examples: A great white shark was spotted near the beach
Sharks play a vital role in ocean ecosystems
That loan shark charges extremely high interest rates
He's a shark when it comes to business negotiations

definitions: entrance hall or waiting area in a building
group seeking to influence politicians on a particular issue
examples: Please wait in the hotel lobby for your guide
The lobby features marble floors and crystal chandeliers
The environmental lobby pushed for stricter pollution laws
Corporate lobbies spend millions influencing policy decisions

definitions: paved path for pedestrians alongside a street or road
examples: Children drew colorful pictures on the sidewalk with chalk
The sidewalk needs repair after the winter storms

definitions: person who runs, especially in races or for exercise
long narrow carpet or rug, especially for hallways
examples: The marathon runner crossed the finish line exhausted
Early morning runners fill the park every day
We need a new runner for the hallway upstairs
The table runner adds elegance to dinner parties

definitions: joint connecting the foot to the leg in humans and animals
examples: She twisted her ankle while hiking yesterday afternoon
The ankle bracelet was part of his parole requirements

definitions: quality or feature that evokes interest, desire, or liking for something
place of interest that draws visitors or tourists
examples: The main attraction of the job is flexible hours
There's a strong attraction between those two people
The waterfall is the area's biggest tourist attraction
The new museum became an instant local attraction

definitions: compassion or forgiveness shown toward someone within one's power to punish
examples: The judge showed mercy to the first-time offender
They begged for mercy but received none at all

definitions: sequence of musical notes that forms a recognizable melody
proper adjustment or functioning condition of something
examples: She hummed a familiar tune while cooking dinner
The band played popular tunes from the eighties
The piano needs a tune after years of neglect
Keep your engine in tune with regular maintenance

definitions: person who performs dance movements professionally or as a hobby
examples: The ballet dancer practiced for hours every day
Professional dancers need strength and incredible flexibility

definitions: cylinder of wax with a wick that burns to produce light
examples: She lit a candle during the power outage
Birthday candles decorated the chocolate cake beautifully

definitions: thin pointed metal tool used for sewing with thread
thin hollow instrument used for injections or drawing blood
examples: She threaded the needle to mend the torn shirt
Finding a needle in a haystack seems impossible
The nurse prepared a sterile needle for the injection
Diabetics often use needles multiple times daily

definitions: factual written account of events in the order they occurred
examples: The chronicle details the town's hundred-year history
Medieval chronicles provide valuable historical insights today

definitions: residential area on the outskirts of a city or large town
examples: They moved to a quiet suburb to raise children
The suburb offers good schools and safe neighborhoods

definitions: device that detects or measures physical properties and records or responds
examples: The motion sensor triggered the security lights immediately
Modern cars have sensors monitoring various engine functions

definitions: first public appearance or performance of a person or thing
examples: The actress made her debut in a small theater
The product's debut exceeded all sales expectations

definitions: great size or extent of something measurable
great importance or seriousness of something
examples: Scientists measured the earthquake's magnitude at 6.5
The magnitude of the universe is beyond comprehension
They underestimated the magnitude of the problem entirely
The magnitude of her achievement became clear later

definitions: feeling that something is possible, likely, or true without proof
very small amount or trace of something
examples: His suspicion proved correct when evidence emerged later
She viewed the stranger with suspicion and caution
Add just a suspicion of garlic to the sauce
There's a suspicion of frost in the air

definitions: image or symbol representing something, especially on computer screens
person or thing regarded as representative symbol or worthy of admiration
examples: Click the folder icon to open your documents
Religious icons decorated the walls of the chapel
She became a fashion icon in the 1960s
The singer is an icon of pop culture

definitions: informal term for grandmother, the mother of one's parent
examples: Grandma bakes the best chocolate chip cookies ever
We visit grandma every Sunday for family dinner

definitions: informal shortened form of information, meaning facts or details
examples: Send me the info about tomorrow's meeting please
The website provides useful info for new students

definitions: official power to make legal decisions and judgments over a particular area
examples: This case falls under federal jurisdiction, not state
The police have no jurisdiction outside city limits

definitions: person who is older or higher in rank or status
student in the final year of high school or college
examples: The senior citizens receive discounts at many stores
She's senior to me in the company hierarchy
High school seniors are preparing for college applications
The senior class organized a memorable graduation party

definitions: public procession celebrating a special day or event with marching
examples: The Thanksgiving parade features giant balloons every year
Rain couldn't dampen spirits at the victory parade

definitions: marine mammal with flippers living in cold seas
device or substance used to close or fasten something securely
official mark or design stamped on documents as authentication
examples: Seals basked on the rocks near the shore
The harbor seals delighted tourists with playful antics
Check the seal on the jar before purchasing
The envelope's wax seal remained perfectly intact
The document bore the official government seal
The royal seal authenticated the ancient decree

definitions: collection of historical documents or records providing information about a place
examples: Researchers studied newspapers in the city's historical archive
The archive contains photographs from the early 1900s

definitions: violent uncontrollable anger or fury
widespread temporary enthusiasm or fashion for something
examples: His rage was evident in his clenched fists
She flew into a rage over the broken vase
Yoga pants were all the rage last year
That hairstyle is the rage among teenagers now

definitions: final part of something, especially a story or event
letter or letters added at the end of a word
examples: The movie's ending surprised everyone in the theater
They changed the ending after negative test screenings
Adding the ending '-ly' turns adjectives into adverbs
Different endings change the meaning of root words

definitions: shape produced by a curve that bends around and crosses itself
sequence of instructions that repeats until a condition is met
examples: She tied the rope in a simple loop
The roller coaster features three giant loops
The program got stuck in an infinite loop
Use a loop to process each array element

definitions: act of pursuing someone or something to catch or catch up
examples: The police chase lasted for twenty minutes downtown
The cat gave chase when the mouse ran

definitions: formal social occasion held to welcome someone or celebrate
quality of broadcast signals received by radio or television
way in which something is greeted or received by people
examples: The wedding reception was held at a hotel
They hosted a reception for the new ambassador
The phone gets poor reception in rural areas
Check the antenna to improve television reception
The book received a warm reception from critics
His ideas met with a cold reception initially

definitions: person who lives in or comes from a particular area or neighborhood
examples: Ask a local for the best restaurant recommendations
The locals know all the hidden beaches nearby

definitions: statement or idea that forms the basis for a theory or argument
house or building with its land and outbuildings
examples: The whole argument rests on a false premise
We must examine the premise before reaching conclusions
Security guards patrol the premise every two hours
No smoking is allowed on the premise

definitions: very large marine mammal with horizontal tail fin and blowhole
examples: The blue whale is Earth's largest living animal
Tourists hope to see whales during migration season

definitions: quality of being trusted and believed in based on reputation or evidence
examples: The scandal damaged her credibility as a journalist
Scientific credibility requires peer review and verification

definitions: quality of being faithful and devoted to someone or something
examples: Customer loyalty keeps businesses thriving during tough times
Her loyalty to friends never wavered through difficulties
